qas.question: Which Hindu school stresses dualism between consciousness and matter?
How does Samkhya view the universe?
What is the Samkhya name for consciousness?
What is the Samkhya school word for matter?
What does the joining of Purusa and Prakriti produce?
What is the state of prakriti splitting from purusa?

plausible_answers.text: that state in which puruṣa is bonded to prakriti

qas.question: What did the emergence of buddhi create?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Samkhya<b5_0/><a0_0/> school espouses dualism between consciousness and matter. It regards the universe as consisting of <a1_0>two realities<a1_0/>; <a2_0>Puruṣa<a2_0/> (<b9_0>consciousness<b9_0/>) and <a3_0>prakriti<a3_0/> (matter). <b6_0>Jiva<b6_0/> (a living being) is <b7_0>that state in which puruṣa is bonded to prakriti<b7_0/> in some form. This fusion, state the Samkhya scholars, led to the emergence of <a4_0>buddhi<a4_0/> (awareness, intellect) and ahankara (individualized ego consciousness, “I-maker”). <b8_0>The universe<b8_0/> is described by this school as one created by Purusa-Prakriti entities infused with various permutations and combinations of variously enumerated elements, senses, feelings, activity and mind.
